pages.text: $(info) To make $(item)Refractory Brick$(), you need to make $(item)Flint Clay$():$(p)1. First, crush $(item)Flint Shards$() to produce $(item)Crushed Flint$().$(p)2. Next, melt some $(item)Clay$() into $(item)Liquid Clay$().$(p)3. Finally, soak the $(item)Crushed Flint$() in the $(item)Liquid Clay$() to obtain $(item)Flint Clay$().

$(info) Next, you need $(item)Slaked Lime$().$(p)1. First, crush $(item)Limestone Rocks$() to produce $(item)Crushed Limestone$().$(p)2. Next, fire the $(item)Crushed Limestone$() into $(item)Quicklime$().$(p)3. Finally, soak the $(item)Quicklime$() in $(item)Water$() to obtain $(item)Slaked Lime$().

$(info) Combine $(item)Clay Balls$(), $(item)Flint Clay$(), $(item)Slaked Lime$(), and $(item)Ash$() to make $(item)Refractory Clay$().$(p)$(info) Fire the $(item)Unfired Refractory Bricks$() in a $(thing)Combustion Kiln$() to obtain a usable product.
$(info) $(item)Refractory Blocks$() are used in the construction of the $(item)Bloomery$(), $(thing)Refractory Machines$(), and enclosures for $(thing)Refractory Burning$().
